Mike,

This list is probably the right place to go if you want to find out if 
what you've got is "probably" authentic, and
get some idea as to date, style, etc., if legitimate, and is a great 
place to start if you actually wish to
learn more about tsuba, fittings, etc.,.

That being said, the easiest first step would be to take some pictures 
or scans of the tsuba, put them up on your website
(or just get a yahoo photos account - they're free, and you can store 30 
meg of pictures there), and post pointers to the
pictures on this list - there are actually a number of knowledgable 
individuals on this list, and you'll usually get at least
some comments about them...

Good Luck,

rkg
(Richard George)


>Hello,
>I am new on this site and am also the recipient of about a dozen tsuba. I was told that they are dated somewhere around the third century? My question is where do I go to get an honest apraised value on these items. I am not a collector of this type so have no earthly idea where to seek information. Any help would be greatly appreciated.
>Thanks,
>Mike
